node.title: Finance gets on the sports field: Fans 'feel they've lost the game'
node.description: The US equity firm which is set to invest in NZ Rugby does not invest in anything unless it sees profit in it, says the UK-based co-host of a podcast which digs into the influence of finance in theâ€¦ Audio

node.title: Nico Porteous suffers knee injury
node.description: Olympic gold medalist Nico Porteous has been forced off the competitive ski slopes.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 5662 new cases, nine further deaths
node.description: There have been 5562 new community cases of Covid-19 reported in New Zealand today, the lowest in two months, with nine further deaths.

node.title: Motorcyclist's death takes Anzac road toll to 10
node.description: Ten people have now died on New Zealand's roads this Anzac weekend, with a motorcyclist dying after a crash on State Highway 4 near Raetihi.

node.title: Aotearoa prepares to mark Anzac Day in orange setting
node.description: The Returned and Services Association says most preparations for Anzac Day commemorations across the country are now complete.

node.title: Ukraine invasion casts ugly pall on Anzac commemorations
node.description: A man whose godson is fighting in Mariupol says it will be difficult commemorating fallen Anzac heroes when there are living heroes still fighting in Ukraine.

node.title: Police name four teens killed in Invercargill crash on Friday
node.description: A Southland softball team - which one of the four teenagers killed in a crash on Friday belonged to - say they are devastated by his death.

node.title: Wildfires hit Southeast as season starts "dangerously early"
node.description: Hundreds of structures were lost in a growing number of wind-driven blazes across drought-stricken New Mexico.

node.title: Letters offer a rare look inside the mind of "The Dexter Killer"
node.description: Mark Twitchell, a Canadian filmmaker, is dubbed "The Dexter Killer" because of the numerous links between the TV series and his real-life crimes.

node.title: Wellington firearms incidents likely gang-related, police say
node.description: Police say the firearms incidents in central Wellington and Tawa yesterday are believed to be gang-related.

node.title: Disabled whio may have set new age record for her species
node.description: A disabled whio who can't fly may now be one of the oldest of her kind.

node.title: Russia could unleash malicious cyber campaigns: NZ and Five Eyes partners warn
node.description: New Zealand and its Five Eyes partners are warning that Russia could unleash malicious cyber campaigns amid its war in Ukraine.

node.title: Orrin Hatch, longtime Republican senator, dies at age 88
node.description: Hatch was the longest-serving Republican senator in history as he represented Utah for more than four decades.

node.title: Two vessels that crashed 'fell well short of good practice', investigation finds
node.description: An investigation has found that the monitoring of two vessels that crashed into each other in Tauranga last year fell well short of good practice.

node.title: Covid-19 XE variant: Vaccination remains best defence, epidemiologist says
node.description: An epidemiologist says it is still unclear whether the new Covid-19 variant is more transmissible than Omicron.

node.title: US Congresswoman: I did not call for violent insurrection
node.description: A US congresswoman has denied calling for an "insurrection" in Washington as part of a trial challenging her right to stand for re-election.

node.title: Industry calls for alcohol manufacture tax rate to be reduced
node.description: An expected rise in taxes on alcohol to match inflation will be crippling for manufacturers and importers, an industry group says.

node.title: Iwi aims to get 'back on track' after years of division over Shelly Bay land
node.description: A unification process has started between Mau Whenua and the Port Nicholson Block Settlement Trust over land at Wellington's Shelly Bay.

node.title: Anzac road toll reaches nine after two die in crashes overnight
node.description: Nine people have now died on New Zealand's roads this Anzac weekend, with two dead after North Island crashes last night and early this morning.

node.title: Michigan GOP endorses Trump-backed candidates for AG, SoS
node.description: Michigan Republicans will formally nominate candidates at their convention in August.

node.title: Chiefs finish strong to put away Waratahs
node.description: The Chiefs have eventually fought off the Waratahs to win the first trans-Tasman match of the Super Rugby Pacific season.

node.title: Zelensky warns Russia is eyeing other countries after Ukraine
node.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky warned that Russia's invasion of his country was just the beginning and that Moscow has designs on capturing other countries.

node.title: Search continues for missing Texas National Guard soldier
node.description: Texas officials say the soldier went missing after attempting to help two migrants who appeared to be drowning.

node.title: Community mourns four teen crash victims
node.description: 'Rest in love boys,' say messages as community mourns four teenagers, three 16 and one 17, killed in yesterday's crash in Invercargill.

node.title: Detroit Tigers' Miguel Cabrera gets 3,000th hit
node.description: Cabrera became the 33rd Major League Baseball player to reach the milestone.

node.title: Motorcyclist's death raises Anzac weekend road toll to 7
node.description: A motorcyclist has died after crashing in Whakatane, Bay of Plenty.

node.title: Disabled 'forgotten' in Covid response - inquiry
node.description: The New Zealand Disability Support Network says disabled people were forgotten about in the Covid-19 response, after a Human Rights Commission inquiry found their wellbeing was put at risk.

node.title: More than 92 pounds of fentanyl seized in California
node.description: The amount of the synthetic opioid seized is equivalent to 42 kilograms.

node.title: Antony Blinken and Lloyd Austin headed to Kyiv, Zelenskyy says
node.description: The Ukranian president told reporters Saturday during a lengthy news conference that two top U.S. officials will visit the capital.

node.title: Man charged with threatening Merriam Webster over gender definitions
node.description: The man could face prison time if convicted for what officials described as "despicable" and "hate-filled" messages.
